story:
Once upon a time, in a land filled with gardens of roses and fields of tulips, there was a kind and curious little girl named Leila. Leila lived in a cozy house with her mother, father, and baby brother. She loved exploring the world around her, and she always made sure to help her family and friends.

One day, while Leila was playing in the garden, she discovered a tiny door hidden behind a cluster of roses. The door was so small that it could only be opened by a child. Leila cautiously opened the door and stepped inside.

To her amazement, she found herself in a magical world filled with talking animals, sparkling streams, and towering trees. She met a wise old owl who told her that she had been chosen to become the guardian of the magical world.

Leila was overjoyed and accepted the responsibility with open arms. She spent her days learning about the magical world and its inhabitants. She made friends with a mischievous monkey, a gentle deer, and a wise old tortoise.

But being the guardian of the magical world was not always easy. Leila had to make sure that the magical world remained safe and hidden from those who would seek to harm it. She also had to help the animals when they were in need.

One day, a group of wicked witches tried to steal the magical world's most precious treasure, a glowing crystal that gave the magical world its power. Leila and her friends worked together to stop the witches and protect the crystal.

In the end, they were successful, and the magical world was saved. Leila was hailed as a hero and celebrated by all the animals. From that day on, Leila continued to protect and care for the magical world, and she always made sure to use its magic for good.

As Leila grew older, she realized that the lessons she learned in the magical world were just as important in her own world. She learned to be kind, brave, and always ready to help those in need.

And so, Leila lived happily, knowing that she had made a difference in both the magical world and her own.

Goodnight my dear daughter, may you always be as kind, brave and helpful as Leila. Sweet dreams.
